section.title: Axioms
section.para: Each Concept is logically defined by it's relationships to other concepts.

section.title: Classifier
section.para: The Knowledge Editor integrates a high performance Classifier--SnoRocket https://aehrc.com/snorocket/--which supports OWL EL++ and Concrete Domains. The classifier evaluates the stated relationships based on Description Logics upon which the terminology is defined and generates the inferred relationships for each concept. The Knowledge Editor displays stated and inferred views of the concept in the concept viewer pane and the Taxonomy displays stated and inferred is-a relationships based on the Taxonomy display options.

simplesect.title: How Do I Run the Classifier?
simplesect.para: There are 2 places in the Knowledge Editor interface to run the classifier: at the main navigation menu under "Authoring" and in the "Classifier" tab on the left pane.

The initial run of the classifier after the start of the system will result in all concepts being evaluated. Subsequent classifications will only evaluate modified concepts, also known as incremental classification. Incremental classification will continue so long as the classifier status cache is maintained. This number is only a measure of how much work the classifier did.

simplesect.title: How Do I View Previous Classifier Results?
simplesect.para: When you open the Classifier tab under the Authoring interface, there is a table of previously run classifications. You may view classifications results selecting a different classification run from the dropdown "Classifier runs".
To view any of these runs, select one and it will display in a concept viewer on the right.

Here, a summary of attributes and types are displayed including:
Added "Is a" Types
This indication that an is-a relationship has been added to the concept by the classifier.
Inactived "Is a" Types
New Attributes
Inactivated Attributes
Cycles Detected
Equivalents Detected
To review the concepts under each of these summaries, select the row. A table listing the identificed concepts will display below the summary list. You also have the option of adding concepts to your briefcase.

If you discover any inaccuracies or equivalencies after a classification, edits must be made directly at the concept level. Refer to "How to Edit a Concept" for information on modifying terminologies.
